contributors.bio: Jody David Armour is Professor of Law at the School of Law, University of Southern California.
contributors.name: Jody David Armour

description: Tackling the ugly secret of unconscious racism in American society, this book provides specific solutions to counter this entrenched phenomenon.
descriptionhtml: Tackling the ugly secret of unconscious racism in American society, this book provides specific solutions to counter this entrenched phenomenon.

reviews.review: "Skillfully drawing on a wide range of referents from Greek mythology to Thomas Byes, the father of statistics, Armour plumbs our racial psychology and in the process explores the racialized nature of our daily life and our legal system."
"A crucial book, at a critical time, just as white America is gradually coming to understand the hidden travails of African American life."
"[C]ommendable in important respects. [Armour] points out problems in the theory of rational racial discrimination that many of its proponents ignore or overlook."
reviews.reviewer: Randall Kennedy, Los Angeles Times Book Review

subtitle: The Hidden Costs of Being Black in America
title: Negrophobia and Reasonable Racism
